intro: Critoniadelphus, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are native to regions in the Mediterranean and parts of southern Europe. They thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making them suitable for rock gardens and borders. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral variations and growth habits.
